title: Website to open and play shared video links

requirements.text: Create a single-page UI where a user can paste a shared video link (URL) and open it in an in-page player.

quotes: a website that open and plays shared video links

acceptanceCriteria: A user can paste a URL into an input field and submit via button and Enter key.
After submit, the app navigates (or updates state) to show the player view with the provided URL visible/editable.
Invalid/empty input is blocked with a clear English error message.

requirements.text: Support playing common types of shared video links: (1) direct video file URLs (e.g., .mp4/.webm/.ogg) via an HTML5 <video> player, and (2) embeddable hosted video pages (e.g., YouTube/Vimeo-style links) via a safe iframe embed fallback.

quotes: a website that open and plays shared video links

acceptanceCriteria: For direct video file URLs, the app renders an HTML5 video element with standard controls (play/pause/seek/volume/fullscreen).
For non-file URLs, the app renders an iframe embed view when possible; otherwise it shows an English message indicating the link cannot be embedded and provides a safe external-open link.
The app does not crash on unsupported URLs.

requirements.text: Enable shareable playback via URL: encode the target video link into the browser URL (query param or route segment) so that opening a shared app link loads the same video automatically.
acceptanceCriteria: When a video is opened, the browser URL updates to include the video link value.
Visiting the app with a populated share URL loads directly into the player view for that video without additional user action.
A "Copy share link" control copies the current app URL to clipboard and shows an English confirmation state.

requirements.text: Add a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across the landing input view and the player view. Avoid a blue/purple primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: The app has a consistent, intentional look (not default browser styling) across all screens.
Spacing, typography, and buttons/inputs look consistent across the app.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets and use them in the UI (stored under frontend/public/assets/generated).
acceptanceCriteria: All required images exist at frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified.
The landing view uses the generated visuals (e.g., hero/background and icon) without routing image loading through the backend.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or the immutable hook entrypoints listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose them instead if needed).
Do not add third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity is allowed (not required for this app).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor if any backend code is added (not required for this scope).
nonGoals: User accounts, playlists, likes, comments, or saved history across sessions.
Uploading or hosting video files inside the app.
Integrations with external video APIs requiring keys (e.g., YouTube Data API).

required: Minimal play-button icon on transparent background (play-icon.dim_128x128.png)
Abstract video/film themed hero illustration with warm neutral palette (video-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
